docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 17 (AP) -A new United Nations survey of the cost of living of international officials in 85 citie around the world shows' tha Tokyo is the most expensive of them all17 per cent above New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 17 (AP) -A new United Nations survey of the cost of living of international officials in 85 citie around the world shows' tha Tokyo is the most expensive of them all17 per cent above New York.
docs.abstract: UN survey of cost of living in major world cities, used to calculate salary differentials for its employes in various cities, finds Tokyo most expensive city, 17% above NYC; cost in several other cities, more and less than cost in NYC, noted

headline.main: U.N. Finds Tokyo Costliest City, 17% Above Here

docs.snippet: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22 -- Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the mountains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22 -- Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the mountains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.

headline.main: 16 Survivors of Oct. 13 Plane Crash Found in Andes; 16 Survivors of an Oct. 13 Plane Crash in the Andes Are Found

docs.snippet: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22 -- Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the mountains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 22 -- Two survivors from a plane that crashed more than two months ago in the Andes climbed down from the mountains today and led rescuers to the site of the wreckage.

headline.main: 16 Survivors of Oct. 13 Plane Crash Found in Andes; 16 Survivors of an Oct. 13 Plane Crash in the Andes Are Found

docs.snippet: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 23 -- Two helicopters today picked up the remaining eight persons from the site of a plane wreckage high in the frozen Andes where 16 survivors had clung to life with meager rations.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FERNANDO, Chile, Dec. 23 -- Two helicopters today picked up the remaining eight persons from the site of a plane wreckage high in the frozen Andes where 16 survivors had clung to life with meager rations.
docs.abstract: helicopters on Dec 23 rescue 16 survivors from wreckage of Uruguayan mil transport, which crashed into Andes Mts on Oct 13 killing 29

headline.main: 8 Survivors of Crash Picked Up in Andes

docs.snippet: 29 victims of crash of Uruguayan mil aircraft will be bried in common grave near wreckage of craft on slope of Andes Mt
docs.abstract: 29 victims of crash of Uruguayan mil aircraft will be bried in common grave near wreckage of craft on slope of Andes Mt

headline.main: 29 Victims in Andes Crash To Receive Common Burial

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 26 (AP) -- Official sources said today that some survivors of a plane crash at 12,000 feet in the Andes told of having eaten parts of the bodies of dead companions to keep from starving in an ordeal of more that two months.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 26 (AP) -- Official sources said today that some survivors of a plane crash at 12,000 feet in the Andes told of having eaten parts of the bodies of dead companions to keep from starving in an ordeal of more that two months.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan officials rept on Dec 26 that survivors of crash of Uruguayan mil aircraft ate parts of bodies of dead companions to keep from starving for 2 mos; survivor describes ordeal

docs.snippet: Two spokesmen for the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York said yesterday that the survivors of a plane crash in the Chilean Andes two months ago "acted justifiably" when they ate parts of bodies of dead companions to keep from starving to death.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two spokesmen for the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York said yesterday that the survivors of a plane crash in the Chilean Andes two months ago "acted justifiably" when they ate parts of bodies of dead companions to keep from starving to death.
docs.abstract: NYC RC Archdiocese says on Dec 27 that survivors of Uruguayan mil plane crash in Andes Mts 'acted justifiably' when they ate parts of bodies of dead companions to keep from starving to death

headline.main: Two Catholic Aides Defend Cannibalism In Chilean Air Crash

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 28 (UPI) -- Survivors of an air crash who spent 10 weeks in the snow-covered Andes in Chile admitted on their homecoming here tonight that they had eaten the flesh of their dead comrades to stay alive.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 28 (UPI) -- Survivors of an air crash who spent 10 weeks in the snow-covered Andes in Chile admitted on their homecoming here tonight that they had eaten the flesh of their dead comrades to stay alive.
docs.abstract: survivors of crash of Uruguayan mil transport admit on Dec 28 that they had eaten flesh of dead comrades to stay alive

headline.main: Survivors of Andes Air Crash Admit Dead Saved Their Lives
